elements

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • elements.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    this class has the details of the camera - location, direction and function that creating rays from the camera.
    Author:
    Li Edri, Adi Giladi

      • constructRayThroughPixel

        public Ray constructRayThroughPixel(int nX,
                                    int nY,
                                    int j,
                                    int i,
                                    double screenDistance,
                                    double screenWidth,
                                    double screenHeight)
        this function create a ray that start in the camera according to current pixel
        Parameters:
        nX - - the number of pixels in the width of the view plane
        nY- - the number of pixels in the Height of the view plane
        j - - index of column
        i - - index of row
        screenDistance - - he distance between the camera and the view plane
        screenWidth - - the width of the view plane
        screenHeight - - the width of the view plane
        Returns:
        - the ray from the current pixel

      • constructRaysThroughPixel

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ray> constructRaysThroughPixel(int nX,
                                                          int nY,
                                                          int j,
                                                          int i,
                                                          double screenDistance,
                                                          double screenWidth,
                                                          double screenHeight)
        this function is constructRayThroughPixel with implement 'super sampling'
        Parameters:
        nX - - the number of pixels in the width of the view plane
        nY- - the number of pixels in the Height of the view plane
        j - - index of column
        i - - index of row
        screenDistance - - he distance between the camera and the view plane
        screenWidth - - the width of the view plane
        screenHeight - - the width of the view plane
        Returns:
        list of rays

      • constructRaysThroughEdgesPixel

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ray> constructRaysThroughEdgesPixel(int nX,
                                                               int nY,
                                                               int j,
                                                               int i,
                                                               double screenDistance,
                                                               double screenWidth,
                                                               double screenHeight,
                                                               double dx,
                                                               double dy)
        refactoring - this function construct 4 Rays Through the edges of the Pixel, for adaptive super sampling.
        Parameters:
        nX - - the number of pixels in the width of the view plane
        nY- - the number of pixels in the Height of the view plane
        j - - index of column
        i - - index of row
        screenDistance - - he distance between the camera and the view plane
        screenWidth - - the width of the view plane
        screenHeight - - the width of the view plane
        dx - - tell us where is the x start in the pixel
        dy - - tell us where is the y start in the pixel
        Returns:
        list of 4 rays - the edges of the square

      • constructRaysThroughCentersPixel

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ray> constructRaysThroughCentersPixel(int nX,
                                                                 int nY,
                                                                 int j,
                                                                 int i,
                                                                 double screenDistance,
                                                                 double screenWidth,
                                                                 double screenHeight,
                                                                 double dx,
                                                                 double dy,
                                                                 double a)
        refactoring - this function construct 5 Rays Through the centers of the Pixel, for adaptive super sampling.
        Parameters:
        nX - - the number of pixels in the width of the view plane
        nY- - the number of pixels in the Height of the view plane
        j - - index of column
        i - - index of row
        screenDistance - - he distance between the camera and the view plane
        screenWidth - - the width of the view plane
        screenHeight - - the width of the view plane
        dx - - tell us where is the x start in the pixel
        dy - - tell us where is the y start in the pixel
        a - - how much to take from the pixel
        Returns:
        list of 5 rays center, up, down, right, left
